name: Lumpia Mollica
author: jmollica23
summary: Filipino version of the egg rolls.
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat; cook and stir onion, celery, and carrot until onion is tender and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes
Celery and carrot may still be crisp; season with salt
Continue to cook and stir until pork is no longer pink
Drain any excess grease and stir in red pepper flakes, garlic powder, turmeric, ginger, cumin, coriander, and celery seed
Place about 1 tablespoon pork mixture on a lumpia wrapper with one corner facing you
Fold corner closest to you over filling; fold two side corners toward center and continue rolling wrapper around pork
Brush a small amount of water over the top corner and press to seal
Repeat with remaining filling and wrappers
Heat 1 quart vegetable oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Fry rolls in batches until golden brown, 4 to 6 minutes
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate
